sources.title: Woori, KEB Hana Bank fined for misselling derivative-linked funds
sources.snippet: South Korea's financial regulator fined Woori Bank 19.71 billion won and KEB Hana Bank 16.78 billion won and banned both the banks from selling private equity funds for six months after they were found to have engaged in misselling derivative-linked funds.. The banks will be barred from selling private equity funds from March 5 to Sept. 4, the Financial Services Commission said March 4.
